meta.content: The most interesting and talked about stories, videos and pictures on the web. Breaking news on Technology, Politics, Entertainment, and more!

meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: The "rule number one of the web," according to Mashable, is "don't mess with the Oatmeal." Last week, Buzzfeed messed with the Oatmeal.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R2qChr&via=Digg&text=Clash Of The Titans

div.a: What Boiling Hot Water Looks Like When Thrown From A Balcony In -41ºF Weather

div.div: This Russian man demonstrates what a boiling-hot pot of water looks like when it’s thrown from a six-story balcony in -41.8 °F temperatures.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TWFwTy&via=Digg&text=What Boiling Hot Water Looks Like When Thrown From A Balcony In -41ºF Weather

div.a: In Two Weeks, The Mississippi Could Shut Down

div.div: The worst drought in half a century has brought water levels in the Mississippi close to historic lows and could shut down all shipping in a matter of weeks – unless Barack Obama takes extraordinary measures.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12k6omW&via=Digg&text=In Two Weeks, The Mississippi Could Shut Down

div.a: 'Hollywood Hacker' Gets 10 Years For Leaking Scarlett Johansson Nude Photos, Other Crimes

div.div: A federal judge on Monday sentenced a man who hacked into the personal online accounts of Scarlett Johansson, Mila Kunis and other women to 10 years in prison.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/TWBqLj&via=Digg&text='Hollywood Hacker' Gets 10 Years For Leaking Scarlett Johansson Nude Photos, Other Crimes

div.a: Why Is The Shooter Always Male?

div.div: Stats don't lie. Instead of asking why America is so violent, perhaps we need to focus on one particular sex.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UMkOXE&via=Digg&text=Why Is The Shooter Always Male?

div.div: LEGAL EAGLES ON ENDANGERED SPECIES LIST
As of December 7th, law school applications are down 24.6% from the same time last year, while the total number of applicants has declined by 22.4% year over year.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UEjQwA&via=Digg&text=Law School Applications Are Collapsing

div.a: The Case For Apple's Stock Price Falling To $270

div.div: Since January, Edward Zabitsky of Toronto-based ACI Research has been arguing that Apple is headed to $270 a share. He now sees the stock reaching that level in 12 months.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UuuOEu&via=Digg&text=The Case For Apple's Stock Price Falling To $270

div.a: Pictures Of Einstein As A Child

div.div: Here are a few pictures of Albert Einstein when he was just a kid.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WiMBjv&via=Digg&text=Pictures Of Einstein As A Child

div.a: Who Likes Bling? The Answer Relates To Social Status

div.div: A desire for expensive, high-status goods is related to feelings of social status – which helps explain why some groups are attracted to bling, a new study suggests.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/XARUdf&via=Digg&text=Who Likes Bling? The Answer Relates To Social Status

div.div: The (arguably) most prolific primetime cartoon ever has tapped social gaming for a gag once more. In the latest episode of The Simpsons, Homer whips out his iPad--err, MyPad--to play some VillageVille.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZdaBKo&via=Digg&text=The Simpsons Spoofs Zynga

div.div: Presidents Bill Clinton, George W. Bush and Barack Obama take a moment to address the nation in the wake of a school shooting.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T2wUxv&via=Digg&text=The Three Speeches

div.a: Want To Watch Two Probes Crash Into The Moon Today?

div.div: Two NASA probes are scheduled to slam into the rim of a lunar crater today. Here's how to watch.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/12vg3Gq&via=Digg&text=Want To Watch Two Probes Crash Into The Moon Today?

div.a: Cards Against Humanity Decides What To Do With $70K

div.div: Brilliant infographic from the Cards Against Humanity team. Now I know how much boar sperm costs! - cardsagainsthumanity.com/h...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UuWWqY&via=Digg&text=Cards Against Humanity Decides What To Do With $70K

div.div: FIRST EPISODE ABOUT PRINCES OF THE UNIVERSE

div.a: Queen Guitarist To Host Astronomy Show?

div.div: Queen guitarist Brian May should replace Sir Patrick Moore on BBC1’s Sky At Night, leading astronomy professors have claimed, hailing the musician as one of the few space enthusiasts who could live up to the deceased presenter’s “common touch.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WjRcSr&via=Digg&text=Queen Guitarist To Host Astronomy Show?

div.a: Here's 10 Minutes Of Unreleased 'Star Trek Into Darkness' Footage

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UEcMiB&via=Digg&text=Here's 10 Minutes Of Unreleased 'Star Trek Into Darkness' Footage

div.div: By January, many were already reporting reporting that 2012 was going to be a big year for UFO sightings. But 2012 wasn't just a big year for flying saucer sightings — it was a big year for the paranormal in general.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/ZcXvN2&via=Digg&text=The 12 Best Paranormal Sightings Of 2012

div.a: The Social Network That Introduces You To Your Neighbors

div.div: A shocking 28 percent of us know none of our neighbors by name. We may keep in touch with faraway friends on Facebook, but when it comes to hanging out in our own communities we are bowling alone. Now someone is trying to make us a bit more neighborly.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Xyh7F6&via=Digg&text=The Social Network That Introduces You To Your Neighbors

div.div: DOES NOT KILL OTHER MALWARE SADLY

div.a: Tantalizing Clues In Dexter Malware Lead To Mystery Man... And Zeus

div.div: The latest malware of the moment is getting stranger and stranger.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/R0S92M&via=Digg&text=Tantalizing Clues In Dexter Malware Lead To Mystery Man... And Zeus

div.div: Here’s a thought for the harried among us who are unready for the arrival of another Christmas season: There was a time when some scholars argued that the holiday should be observed in the spring. Just imagine three more months of shopping!

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SE5UGy&via=Digg&text=Why Is Christmas In December?

div.a: New York, A Graveyard For Languages

div.div: Home to around 800 different languages, New York is a delight for linguists, but also provides a rich hunting ground for those trying to document languages threatened with extinction.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Y6ycuT&via=Digg&text=New York, A Graveyard For Languages

div.a: The Bloody Truth About Serbia's Vampire

div.div: Garlic sales are up. Wooden crosses are a hot commodity. That can only mean one thing: Vampire on the loose!

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T4hJnn&via=Digg&text=The Bloody Truth About Serbia's Vampire

div.a: Bankers Get No Jail Time For Terrorist Financing While Somali Sentenced For Charity

div.div: While HSBC was recently let off with no jail time for engaging in money laundering that involved terrorist organizations, a Somali woman was sentenced for sending money back home to help her family.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Zzx0k1&via=Digg&text=Bankers Get No Jail Time For Terrorist Financing While Somali Sentenced For Charity

div.a: Breathtaking Underwater Scenes Shot By A Software Architect Turned Photographer

div.div: Here are some really stunning pictures taken during the annual sardine run off the coast of South Africa.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/T46I5F&via=Digg&text=Breathtaking Underwater Scenes Shot By A Software Architect Turned Photographer

div.a: How The Software That Guarantees Total Anonymity Is Helping The FBI

div.div: TOR is one of the most important pieces of software in ensuring anonymity online. Many might assume that it is used solely by hackers, but as it turns out, it's also heavily employed by law enforcement agencies like the FBI.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VJDBl5&via=Digg&text=How The Software That Guarantees Total Anonymity Is Helping The FBI

div.a: The New 'Star Trek' Teaser Trailer Is Out

div.div: Here's the new "Star Trek" trailer for your viewing pleasure.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/U7wiY4&via=Digg&text=The New 'Star Trek' Teaser Trailer Is Out

div.a: A Clever Photo Prank From Half A Century Ago

div.div: Here's a cool little vintage prank that takes advantage of the lengthy exposure time required in old photographs.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/UEumnu&via=Digg&text=A Clever Photo Prank From Half A Century Ago

div.a: Video Of The Huge Asteroid That Buzzed By Earth Last Week

div.div: Using the antenna from the Deep Space Network, NASA created radar data images of the irregularly-shaped asteroid and used them to create the video below.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/WiS4qA&via=Digg&text=Video Of The Huge Asteroid That Buzzed By Earth Last Week

div.a: The 10 Most Expensive Cars In The World

div.div: Here are 10 of the most expensive street legal production cars on the market (at least 2 available); concept cars are not included.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Wj54fE&via=Digg&text=The 10 Most Expensive Cars In The World

div.a: When Twitter And Instagram Are Called As Witnesses In A Rape Case

div.div: One August night in Steubenville, Ohio, a group of teenagers gathered for an end of summer party. By the end of the night, Twitter posts, videos and photographs suggested that an unconscious girl had been sexually assaulted over several hours while others watched.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RzAiBI&via=Digg&text=When Twitter And Instagram Are Called As Witnesses In A Rape Case

div.div: The prospect of once again hitting the federal debt ceiling has provoked the ritual round of hand-wringing about the intractable nature of this $16 trillion conundrum. But there is a simple, elegant option that involves no tax increases, no spending cuts and just a bit of imagination. Sell Alaska.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/V1qtvj&via=Digg&text=The Case For Selling Alaska

div.div: Fired from her schoolteaching job after revealing she had once been a Craigslist call girl, Melissa Petro describes the world that awaits people who leave the trade.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RzxvIJ&via=Digg&text=Life After Sex Work

div.a: Teen Hacker 'Cosmo The God' Allegedly Breaks His Parole To Hack Westboro Baptist Church

div.div: Infamous 15-year-old hacker Cosmo the God of the Underground Nazi Hacktivist Group (UGNazi) has supposedly hacked the Twitter account of much-reviled Westboro member Shirley Phelps-Roper. Of course, it might also not be him.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/VLuCji&via=Digg&text=Teen Hacker 'Cosmo The God' Allegedly Breaks His Parole To Hack Westboro Baptist Church

div.a: Guns In America And The Limits Of Shame

div.div: What does it take for a society to be sickened by its own behavior and to change its attitudes?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ryw79c&via=Digg&text=Guns In America And The Limits Of Shame

div.a: Is This The Most Easily Scared Guy In The World?

div.div: Basse Andersen might be the most easily scared man in the world.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RzvfkD&via=Digg&text=Is This The Most Easily Scared Guy In The World?
